00002 /*!  \file octeon_mem_ops.h
00003      \brief Host Driver: Routines used to read/write Octeon memory.
00004 */
00005 
00006 #ifndef __OCTEON_MEM_OPS_H__
00007 #define __OCTEON_MEM_OPS_H__

00010 #include  "octeon_hw.h"
00011 
00012 
00013 #define    OCT_CORE_BAR1_MAPS       MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX
00014 #define    OCT_CORE_MEM_BEGIN       0x00000000
00015 #define    OCT_CORE_MEM_END         (OCT_CORE_MEM_BEGIN + (MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX * (1 << 22)))
00016 
00017 
00018 
00019 /** Map the Octeon memory into host virtual memory using BAR1 index registers.
00020   * The routine checks that the range given by (end - start) will fit in the
00021   * available BAR1 index registers. If it does, it creates the mapping and
00022   * stores the PCI mapped address for the range (end - start) in an internal
00023   * structure.
00024   */
00025 uint32_t
00026 octeon_map_device_range(octeon_device_t   *oct,
00027                         uint64_t           start,
00028                         uint64_t           end);
00029 
00030 
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 /** Get the PCI address by looking up the core_addr to the device's internal
00035  *  mapping table. If the region of core_addr is mapped, return the PCI address,
00036  *  else return NULL.
00037  */
00038 void *
00039 octeon_get_mapped_addr(octeon_device_t  *oct,
00040                        uint64_t          core_addr);
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 /**  Read a 64-bit value from a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00047  *   @param  oct        -  pointer to the octeon device.
00048  *   @param  core_addr  -  the address to read from.
00049  *
00050  *   The range_idx gives the BAR1 index register for the range of address
00051  *   in which core_addr is mapped.
00052  *
00053  *   @return  64-bit value read from Core memory
00054  */
00055 uint64_t
00056 octeon_read_device_mem64(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t  core_addr);
00057 
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 /**  Read a 32-bit value from a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00062  *   @param  oct        -  pointer to the octeon device.
00063  *   @param  core_addr  -  the address to read from.
00064  *
00065  *   @return  32-bit value read from Core memory
00066  */
00067 uint32_t
00068 octeon_read_device_mem32(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t core_addr);
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072 
00073 /**  Read a 16-bit value from a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00074  *   @param  oct       -  pointer to the octeon device.
00075  *   @param  core_addr -  the address to read from.
00076  *
00077  *   @return  16-bit value read from Core memory
00078  */
00079 uint16_t
00080 octeon_read_device_mem16(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t core_addr);

00085 /**  Read a 8-bit value from a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00086  *   @param  oct        -  pointer to the octeon device.

00088  *
00089  *   @return  8-bit value read from Core memory
00090  */
00091 uint8_t
00092 octeon_read_device_mem8(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t core_addr);

00097 /**  Write a 64-bit value to a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00098  *   @param  oct         -  pointer to the octeon device.
00099  *   @param  core_addr   -  the address to write to.
00100  *   @param  val64       -  64-bit value to write.
00101  *
00102  *   The range_idx gives the BAR1 index register for the range of address
00103  *   in which core_addr is mapped. 
00104  *
00105  *   @return  Nothing.
00106  */
00107 int
00108 octeon_write_device_mem64(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t core_addr, uint64_t val);
00109 
00110 
00111 
00112 
00113 /**  Write a 32-bit value to a BAR1 mapped core memory address.
00114  *   @param  oct        -  pointer to the octeon device.
00115  *   @param  core_addr  -  the address to write to.
00116  *   @param  val32      -  32-bit value to write.
00117  *
00118  *   @return  Nothing.
00119  */
00120 int
00121 octeon_write_device_mem32(octeon_device_t   *oct, uint64_t core_addr, uint32_t val);

00151 /** Read multiple bytes from Octeon memory using the defined SWAP type. Also
00152   * check the octeon_read_core_memory() function, that reads Octeon memory with
00153   * an assumed swap of 64-bit.
00154   */
00155 void
00156 octeon_pci_read_core_mem(octeon_device_t   *oct,
00157                          uint64_t           coreaddr,
00158                          uint8_t           *buf,
00159                          uint32_t           len,
00160                          int                swap);
00161 
00162 
00163 /** Write multiple bytes into Octeon memory using the defined SWAP type. Also
00164   * check the octeon_write_core_memory() function, that writes Octeon memory
00165   * with an assumed swap of 64-bit.
00166   */
00167 void
00168 octeon_pci_write_core_mem(octeon_device_t   *oct,
00169                          uint64_t            coreaddr,
00170                          uint8_t            *buf,
00171                          uint32_t            len,
00172                          int                 swap);
